Instrument_name: Adolescent Social Connections and Coping during COVID-19 Questionnaire - Social connections and Prosocial Behavior
Instrument_description: Questionnaire about children's social connections and prosocial behavior during the COVID-19 pandemic

The Alabama Parenting Questionnaire measures five dimensions of parenting that are relevant to the etiology and treatment of child externalizing problems: (1) positive involvement with children, (2) supervision and monitoring, (3) use of positive discipline techniques, (4) consistency in the use of such discipline and (5) use of corporal punishment.
Task in which the participant gets a list of words with which they have to create a coherent story
The Behavioral Inhibition and Activation System consists of 24 items with 3 BAS-related subscales (BAS Drive, BAS Fun seeking, BAS Reward Responsiveness) and one BIS-related subscale.
The Brief Symptom Inventory (BSI) consists of 53 items. Within L-CID, 21 items are used on Interpersonal sensitivity, Depression, Anxiety and Hostility
The Out of school activities questionnaire consists of items about out-of-school activities of the children, e.g, dance, music, sports. It asks about type, frequency and duration
Task where the child gets the opportunity to cheat while throwing a ball
Task where the child gets the opportunity to cheat
Task where the child gets the opportunity to cheat when making a word puzzle

Instrument_name: Children's Behavior Questionnaire - Discomfort, Fear, Perceptual sensitivity
Instrument_description: The Children’s Behavior Questionnaire consists of 195 items and 18 subscales. 12 items from the Discomfort subscale (how quickly is the child uncomfortable), 12 from the Fear subscale (how fearful is the child) and 12 from the Perceptual Sensitivity (how sensitive to external stimuli is the child) subscale are used
The Children’s Behavior Questionnaire consists of 18 subscales. The Effortful Control subscale consists of items about Attentional Focusing and Inhibitory control of the child
Social wellbeing questionnaire where the child judges their own social competence in terms of social acceptance, tight friendships, and feelings of self-worth
The Confusion, Hubbub and Order Scale consists of items about chaos within the house (e.g., the house is a mess, noise levels, busy lives, etc.)
Open questions about the COVID-19 situation
Task where the child can determine who receives how much money

Instrument_name: Dutch Reactive and Proactive aggression Questionnaire
Instrument_description: The Dutch Reactive Proactive Aggression Questionnaire consists of 23 items about Proactive and Reactive aggressive behavior of the child

Instrument_name: Early Adolescent Temperament Questionnaire - Discomfort, Fear, Perceptual sensitivity
Instrument_description: The Temperament in Middle Childhood Questionnaire consists of 42 items. Within L-CID, 27 items are used from the Discomfort (how quickly is the child uncomfortable), Fear (how fearful is the child) and Perceptual Sensitivity (how sensitive to external stimuli is the child) subscales.

Instrument_name: Early Adolescent Temperament Questionnaire - Effortful control
Instrument_description: The Early Adolescent Temperament Questionnaire consists of 36 items divided over 4 subscales: Discomfort, Perceptual Sensitivity, Fear, and Effortful Control. The Effortful control subscale consists of items about Attentional Control and Inhibitory Control of the child

Instrument_name: E-diary - Daily structure and activities of the children
Instrument_description: E-diary through the Upinion smartphone app about among other, activities, mood, saliva collection and sleep

Instrument_name: EEG during the Face Processing Task
Instrument_description: EEG during the Face Processing Task
Passive viewing task in which respondents watch positive, neutral and negative child facial expressions
The Family Assessment Device consists of questions about the functioning of the family. Within L-CID, only the 12 items from the General Functioning subscale are used.
Observation of a parent-child interaction in which the parent and the child have to discuss a predetermined set of subjects
Questionnaire about the child's worries about the opinion of others
The Feeling and Thinking Questionnaire is aimed to measure Affective and Cognitive empathy in 8 and 9 year old children
Five minute speech sample
fMRI during the task about the child's self-concept
The Highly Sensitive Child Scale consists of 27 items about the sensitivity of the child (e.g. to sounds, scents, social interaction, etc.). Within L-CID, 13 items are used.

The Individual differences and preferences questionnaire investigates sources of individual differences between the twins with items on differences between the children, e.g., in terms of daily interaction, preferences, relationship with the twins, and hobbies

The Interpersonal Reactivity Index is aimed to measure empathy and consists of 28 items from 4 different subscales. Within L-CID, the 14 items from the empathic concern scale and the perspective-taking scale are used.
Questionnaire about Callous and Unemotional traits of the child
The Investment Models Scale consists of 6 items about marital satisfaction, all of them being used in L-CID.
Device that records sounds from the environment
The Musical Training Questionnaire (BAM) measures the self- and parent-reported experience and skills with music and dance.

MyChild is aimed to measure conscience / internalized compliance and consists of 100 items over 10 different subscales. In L-CID, 46 items from 3 subscales are measured: Empathy, Guilt and Internalized Conduct.

MyChild is aimed to measure conscience / internalized compliance and consists of 100 items over 10 different subscales. In L-CID, 46 items from 3 subscales are measured: Empathy, Guilt and Internalized Conduct.

MyChild is aimed to measure conscience / internalized compliance and consists of 100 items over 10 different subscales. In L-CID, 46 items from 3 subscales are measured: Empathy, Guilt and Internalized Conduct.
Observation of parent-child interactions during the evening meal
Questionnaire about bullying behaviors and victimization experiences of the child
Questionnaire about COVID-19, e.g., COVID-symptoms, COVID-related behaviors and feelings
The Parenting Attitudes Questionnaire consists of 20 items about the attitudes of parents about raising their children (e.g., when disciplining children is appropriate)

The Parenting Daily Hassles questionnaire consists of 20 items about the frequency and intensity of daily hassles parents may deal with, e.g., having to clean up children's messes or difficulties getting the children ready to go out

The Parenting Practices Questionnaire consists of 62 items about the actions of parents. Within L-CID, 11 items from the warmth/involvement subscale are used, where the child is asked about affection, warmth, involvement and attention of the parent

The Parenting scale consists of 30 items. Within L-CID, items from the Laxness and Overreactivity subscales are used about parent's behavior and opinion about lax and aggressive behavior of the parent in raising their children

The Parenting scale consists of 30 items. Within L-CID, items from the Laxness and Overreactivity subscales are used about parent's behavior and opinion about lax and aggressive behavior of the parent in raising their children
Questionnaire about feelings of stress and anxiety in the past period
The pregnancy questionnaire consists of items about the pregnancy course, duration and outcome of the pregnancy
The Previous Parenting Support questionnaire (Opvoedhulp vragenlijst) is a self-developed questionnaire about previous support that parents have sought in raising their children.

Instrument_name: Purdue Home Stimulation Inventory - Observation, interview
Instrument_description: Observation and interview about household chaos

Instrument_name: Questionnaire home environment - Daily routines (Sleep, Eat, Care, Media, Work)
Instrument_description: The Routines questionnaire investigates family routines in terms of sleep, eating, care, media and work.

Instrument_name: Questions about school-going of the twins
Instrument_description: Questions about school-going of the children, e.g., which grade, type of school, etc.
Task to measure the child's ability for Theory of Mind
Task about the child's self-concept
Observation of parent-child interaction when the parent has to instruct the child to do something (e.g., clean up toys)
Observation of parent-child interaction in which the parent has to forbid the child to do something (e.g., do not touch the toys while the parent plays with them)
Observation of parent-child interaction during the playing of the etch-a-sketch game, in the parent and the child have to collaborate to create a drawing
Observation of parent-child interaction during the playing of a family game
Observation of free play without instructions
Task in which the child has to compare rhythms and judge whether sounds are in sync with a given rhythm
The social contact questions are about the duration, types and importance of the children's social contacts
Questionnaire about social media use, rules and attitudes by the children
Questionnaire about online behavior of the children
Questionnaire about the social wellbeing of the child (e.g., happiness)
The Strength and Difficulties Questionnaire consists of 25 items, divided over 5 subscales: Prosocial, Hyperactivity, Conduct problems, Peer problems, Emotional problems.

Instrument_name: Temperament in Middle Childhood Questionnaire - Discomfort, Fear, Perceptual sensitivity
Instrument_description: The Temperament in Middle Childhood Questionnaire consists of 42 items divided over 4 subscales: Discomfort, Perceptual Sensitivity, Fear, and Effortful Control.

Instrument_name: Temperament in Middle Childhood Questionnaire - Effortful control
Instrument_description: The Temperament in Middle Childhood Questionnaire consists of 42 items divided over 4 subscales: Discomfort, Perceptual Sensitivity, Fear, and Effortful Control. The Effortful control subscale consists of items about Attentional Control and Inhibitory Control of the child

Instrument_name: Twin Social Interaction / Etch-a-Sketch among twins
Instrument_description: Task where the twins play a game of Etch-a-Sketch together
These are a few (generally open) questions about the perceived differences between the twins, e.g., in terms of social skills

Instrument_name: Visual Analogue Scale - Scanner related stress
Instrument_description: The Visual Analogue Scale is a way of measuring stress related to going into the MRI scanner

Instrument_name: Wildman items to screen for social desirability
Instrument_description: The Wildman questionnaire is a measure of social desirability and is embedded within other questionnaire items
